citation.article-title: Chryseobacterium arthrosphaerae sp. nov., isolated from the faeces of pill millipede Arthrosphaera magna Attems from India
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Chryseobacterium arthrosphaerae sp. nov.
Chryseobacterium arthrosphaerae (ar.thro.spha.e′rae. N.L. gen. n. arthrosphaerae of Arthrosphaera, the genus name of the pill millipede Arthrosphaera magna from where the type strain was isolated).
Cells are Gram-staining negative, non-motile, non-spore-forming rods, approximately 1 μm wide and 2 μm long.
Good growth occurs after 48 h on nutrient agar, brain heart infusion agar and tryptic soy agar (all Oxoid) at 11–36 °C.
No growth occurs on MacConkey agar (Oxoid) at 28 °C.
The type strain is unable to grow at 4 °C and 45 °C.
Colonies on nutrient agar are smooth, yellowish, circular, translucent and shiny with entire edges.
Colonies become mucoid and cannot be identified as single entities after prolonged incubation.
The yellow pigment is non-diffusible and non-fluorescent.
Weakly produces acid from d-glucose, maltose and d-mannitol.

No acid is produced from adonitol, l-arabinose, d-arabitol, dulcitol, erythritol, myo-inositol, lactose, melibiose, methyl α-d-glucoside, raffinose, l-rhamnose, trehalose, salicin, d-sorbitol, sucrose or d-xylose.

Urease activity, indole production and hydrolysis of casein, gelatin, starch, DNA and tyrosine are positive; hydrogen sulphide production and activity of arginine dihydrolase, lysine decarboxylase, ornithine decarboxylase and β-galactosidase (ONPG) are negative.

The following compounds are not utilized as sole sources of carbon: d-glucose, maltose, d-mannose, trehalose, acetate, propionate, N-acetylgalactosamine, N-acetylglucosamine, l-arabinose, arbutin, cellobiose, d-galactose, gluconate, glycerol, d-fructose, d-mannitol, maltitol, melibiose, l-rhamnose, d-ribose, sucrose, salicin, trehalose, d-xylose, adonitol, myo-inositol, d-sorbitol, putrescine, cis-aconitate, trans-aconitate, 4-aminobutyrate, adipate, azelate, fumarate, glutarate, dl-3-hydroxybutyrate, itaconate, dl-lactate, 2-oxoglutarate, pyruvate, suberate, citrate, mesaconate, l-alanine, β-alanine, l-ornithine, l-phenylalanine, l-serine, l-aspartate, l-histidine, l-leucine, l-proline, l-tryptophan, 3-hydroxybenzoate, 4-hydroxybenzoate and phenylacetate.

The chromogenic substrates p-nitrophenyl α-d-glucopyranoside, p-nitrophenyl β-d-glucopyranoside, p-nitrophenyl β-d-galactopyranoside, bis-p-nitrophenyl phosphate, bis-p-nitrophenyl-phenyl phosphonate, bis-p-nitrophenyl-phosphoryl choline, 2-deoxythymidine 2′-p-nitrophenyl phosphate, l-alanine p-nitroanilide, γ-l-glutamate p-nitroanilide and l-proline p-nitroanilide are hydrolysed.
p-Nitrophenyl β-d-xylopyranoside and p-nitrophenyl β-d-glucuronide are not hydrolysed.
The major cellular fatty acids (>15 %) are iso-C15 : 0, an unknown fatty acid with an equivalent chain-length of 13.566 and iso-C17 : 1ω9c.
The type strain is CC-VM-7T (=CCUG 57618T =CCM 7645T), isolated from the faeces of the pill millipede Arthrosphaera magna Attems collected in India.
